data.message: Can I ask why some people's account getting disabled?

replies.message: We disable Facebook accounts that don't follow the Facebook Terms, Alvin. Some violations include continued prohibited behavior after receiving a warning or multiple warnings from Facebook, unsolicited contact with others for the purpose of harassment, advertising, promoting, dating or other inappropriate conduct, use of a fake name, impersonation of a person or entity, or other misrepresentation of identity, and posting content that doesn't follow the Facebook Terms. Learn more in our Help Center: http://on.fb.me/1qYcrqp -Sarah

Hi Ashley. Because of the diversity of our community, it's possible that something could be disagreeable or disturbing to you without meeting the criteria for being removed or blocked. For this reason, we offer personal controls over what you see, such as the ability to hide or quietly cut ties with people, Pages, or applications that offend you. Facebook also offers tools to help you deal with bullying and harassment. Learn more at: http://on.fb.me/1rLheSj. -Chantal

TRUTH: facebooks review system is mostly automated. If enough people spam the report buttons on enough posts of one person that persons account will be automatically disabled with nary a person on facebooks side actions to be accounted for. For example during 'flame wars' where one group hates another group they will often gather and report that persons page or group until face book bans his group, page, or the user himself just due to the amount of reports their automated system filed away. This is also an interesting way to get rid of reviews you don't like. For example despite not actually violating any of FB TOS two of my reviews, they wouldn't say which ones, where removed from face book and i was warned i could get banned. reminder, i didn't do anything to warrent having my reviews revoked, they where fair and truthfull and full of information, however either enough people got together to misuse the report buttons OR a powerful enough entity leaned on facebook, i'd wager it's the former.
